body:
sponeta @ http://www.slightlymagic.net/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=3735&p=84303#p84294 writes:

if "Remove unusual target choices" is turned off, it won't affect the spell or ability currently on the stack. I have to go back a step and come back for it to take effect. For example, if I control a creature, then cast Lightning Bolt, then turn off "Remove unusual target choices", I can't target my creature until I click undo and cast Lightning Bolt again.
author: [melvinzh...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/108278210804167927868/)
title: Unchecking "Remove unusual target choice" does not affect current spell on stack
content:
_From [melvinzh...@gmail.com](https://code.google.com/u/108278210804167927868/) on March 05, 2012 23:34:04_

sponeta @ http://www.slightlymagic.net/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=3735&p=84303#p84294 writes:

if "Remove unusual target choices" is turned off, it won't affect the spell or ability currently on the stack. I have to go back a step and come back for it to take effect. For example, if I control a creature, then cast Lightning Bolt, then turn off "Remove unusual target choices", I can't target my creature until I click undo and cast Lightning Bolt again.

_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/magarena/issues/detail?id=179_
